observations.observation: GMV rose to $208,037.11 (3,597 receipts) this snapshot, with 7-day GMV climbing to $27,724.71 (+$622) and 7-day receipt count to 529 (+13). Steady intake cadence continues alongside geographic expansion pulses.

4 new CBSAs appeared this snapshot (non-metro US-ID, 22380, non-metro US-AZ, non-metro US-NV), bringing active metros to 21. The burst-quiet-burst pulse pattern continues — rural and non-metro areas now appearing alongside urban CBSAs, suggesting diffusion is spreading beyond major metro clusters.

Token acceleration has dropped to exactly 1.0x this snapshot (from 1.002-1.004x range over prior several snapshots), while velocity holds at 0.624x. The multi-snapshot streak above 1.0x appears to have reached its ceiling — acceleration is no longer compressing, it's flatlined at the boundary.

8 new CBSAs appeared this snapshot window (31080, 38060, 22220, 37980, 38860, non-metro AL, TN, PA), bringing active metros to 22 — a 36.4% single-window expansion. This is the second 7-8 CBSA burst in recent history, confirming the burst-quiet-burst pulse pattern is structural rather than anomalous.

Token velocity sits at 0.623x this snapshot while acceleration holds at 1.004x — the streak is technically intact but velocity has compressed 17% from the recent 0.746x range, the sharpest single-window decline in recent history. The acceleration streak is clinging to positive territory while the underlying velocity signal has pulled back significantly.

1 new CBSA (19820) appeared this snapshot, bringing active metros to 15. The pulse sequence continues its burst-quiet-burst pattern — this is a quiet-cadence tick following the recent 7-CBSA burst, consistent with the established inter-pulse trickle.

2 new receipts this window brought GMV to $206,886.34 (3,565 total); 7-day GMV rose to $27,082.09 (+$50) and 7-day receipt count to 515. Quiet intake cadence continues between geographic pulses — consistent with the established inter-pulse trickle pattern.

7 new CBSAs appeared this snapshot (CBSA 31080, 38060, 22220, 37980, non-metro AL, TN, PA), bringing active metros to 21 and representing 33.3% new geographic spread. The burst-quiet-burst pulse sequence continues — this is the second 7-CBSA burst in recent history, consistent with the established pattern.

Token velocity compressed to 0.62x this snapshot (from 0.746x range over prior several snapshots) while acceleration holds at 1.003x — still above 1.0x but the sharpest velocity decline in recent history. The acceleration streak is technically intact but velocity has pulled back 17% from its recent range.

Zero new CBSAs this snapshot — active metros hold at 14. Following the 7-CBSA burst two snapshots ago, the pulse sequence has returned to quiet cadence. The burst-quiet-burst pattern continues; the full sequence now reads 3→6→0→0→0→1→9→0→0→0→6→1→1→0→1→1→0→1→7→0→1→7→0, with the next major burst still loading.
